intro: Stigmaphyllon felixii, commonly known as the golden stigmaphyllon, is a flowering plant native to the Atlantic Forest region of Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid tropical climates. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
